txt.en: 'Stop this! All of you!'
'Death pursues you!'
'Death comes....'
'Death consumes you!'
'Father... forgive me....'
'Rise, Meneldil! Heed my Master's call!'
'Aye, that's far enough.'
'Heed my words - slay me this traitor! Need I shame you and do it myself?'
'Rise and spite your line!'
'When has the Lord of Gondor answered to you, Mithrandir? Do I not command my own men?'
'Speak not of my boy, Mithrandir! He is dead! Dead!'
'They have put a fire in his flesh, and his breath shall soon be but smoke.'
'All shall burn, Mithrandir. The West, too, shall burn to ash!'
The Silent Street
'Ashes and smoke scattered in the wind!'
'Do not take him from me! He calls for me, even now!'
'My son is gone and the battle is lost. Maybe not today, nor on the morrow, but we cannot hold forever.'
'Why should I wish to live without him? Should we not come to death as father and son?'
'Nay! I have seen far greater than thou knowest, old Grey fool! Thy hope is naught but shortsighted folly!'
'You have already lost this battle, [placeholder].'
'I have known it since I first looked upon you outside the gates of Dol Guldur.'
'None shall defy the returned King! Long has his crown lain amongst the Dead, but no longer!'
'EÃ¤rnur returns garbed in the mantle of the Dread Terror - his rule shall be endless and sworn forever to my Master's whim.'
'None can defy his claim! Not even the Dead!'
'In death, all bend to the Master's will!'
'Let the failure of the father be made complete!'
'Let the first in a line of vermin find his shame renewed!'
'Why have you come here, my lord?'
'The House of Stewards is no place for one that yet lives!'
'Why does brother fight brother here among the tombs while the war floods the fields beyond the Gate?'
'You do, but there are those that might dispute your will - maddened and cruel as it has become.'
'And what of Faramir's fate?'
'He calls, but he must seek healing before his life fades... and it still may.'
'Your place is among your people - you must fight for them, Denethor! You know in your heart that this is the truth.'
'That is beyond your authority, Denethor. Only the heathen kings of old slew their kin to ease the pain of their own ends.'
'Let go of this madness, Denethor. There is much still that you can do for your people!'
'Let them pass!'
'If you tell us how to pass through the smoke, I will allow you to leave unharmed.'
'The Steward has doomed us all... he must be slain before he can lead us to even greater ruin!'
'I know of you, [placeholder]. You have meddled far too long in the affairs of the Withered Tree!'
'What do you know of this devilry, [placeholder]?'
'This smoke is as stone and none of us can pass! Is this the handiwork of Mithrandir or a trick of the Steward's own design?'
'I expected as much. There are always other ways to force you to speak!'
'Father is a fool. To toil at the feet of a madman is no fate for our line!'
'Come, we must rescue Faramir and put an end to this needless bloodshed!'
'[placeholder], how did you come to this place? No, there is not the time...'
'Stop this madness!'
'I hope we are not too late to save Faramir, but what has become of Beregond?'
'What is this? What has happened here?'
'Labour in battle or healing! It is all in vain!'
'Only the first finger of the Enemy's mighty hand has been cast toward the City. All of the East rises against us!'
'Traitor!'
As the last member of the Withered Tree falls, you feel a wave of dread pass over you...
'The winds of thy hope spite thee and carry upriver a fleet of black sails!'
'Recreant!'
'The time of the West is over. Death or the fate of a slave is all that awaits thee!'
'Thy hope has always been borne of jealousy - of a desire to rule in my stead! To claim every throne in the West!'
'I knew your designs well, Mithrandir. You kept close your halfling, but in our talking, he has revealed all the names and purposes of thy companions.'
'With one hand, you hold me forth as a shield against Mordor, and with the other, you call upon this... Ranger to usurp me!'
'I will not bow to one from such a fallen house, even if his claim were proven beyond all doubt!'
'I would leave the chair to my son, who would rule of his own design and take no guidance from the queer mind of a wizard!'
'Thou have stolen the love of my son, and now, thou hadst stolen the love of my men....'
'Let us be gone from this place, my friends.'
'But thou cannot defy my will: I shall rule my own end!'
'Come thee, hither! Come, if you are not all cowards at the wizard's bidding!'
'Surrender thy torch and begone!'
'The Steward lies within, and my fellows and I have come to have a word with him. This is no business of yours.'
'If you were wise, you would turn about and leave, but I can see that is not your way....'
'Kill them.'
'We have been discovered! To arms!'
'Faramir lives - he is pained and burns with a fever, but he breathes yet!'
'They are breaking through! Hurry and defend the courtyard!'
'To arms!'
'You speak as if the Enemy's victory is certain.'
'What then would you do, Steward of Gondor?'
'It would seem to me that a Steward who surrenders his post in faith would not find the breadth of his love or honour abated.'
'And you would not rob Faramir of his choice while his death still remains in doubt.'
'Away, all of you!'
'So passes Denethor, son of Ecthelion....'
'So too pass the days you have known - for both good and ill they are ended.'
'You will go no further, [placeholder].'
'Evil deeds have been done in Rath DÃ­nen, but let go of the enmity that lies between you now, for it is naught but a design of the Enemy's will.'
'Gothmog ordered you to be spared and brought before him, but he bears no authority over me.'
'Remember this, servants of the Lord, blind in your loyalty: were it not for the treason of Beregond, Faramir would be burned as well.'
'I heed only my Master's call, and my hatred for you and your ilk pales in comparison to His own.'
'Bear away your fallen brothers from this unhappy place and we shall bear Faramir to place of rest and peace... or death if that be his doom.'
'Let this be finished at long last, and let your fate be cast asunder!'
'Our enemies have broken through! Get out here and fight!'
'Do you want to bring the Steward to heel or not? Aid me, my brothers!'
'Forget the tombs! Forget the Steward! Kill them!'
'We cannot have come so far only to fail! Aid me, you fools!'
